[[module CSS]]

.info-container .collapsible-block-folded a{
color: #FFF;}
.info-container .collapsible-block-unfolded-link a{
color: #FFF;
}

#page-content > .collapsible-block {
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    padding: .8em;
    background-color: #e3e3e3;
    border-top: 0.125rem dashed #b5b5b5;
    border-bottom: 0.125rem dashed #b5b5b5;
}

#page-content > .collapsible-block .collapsible-block-content {
    text-align: left;
}

#page-content .license-box .collapsible-block {

    display: unset;

    text-align: unset;

    padding: unset;

    background-color: unset;

    border-top: unset;

    border-bottom: unset;

}



#page-content .license-box .collapsible-block .collapsible-block-content {

    text-align: unset;

}

blockquote,
div.blockquote {
    border: 0.125rem solid #d4d4d4;
    background-color: #F5F5F5;
}

.interview{
    border:solid 2px #d4d4d4;
    text-align: left;
    background:#F5F5F5;
    width:90%;
    padding:1px 15px;
    margin: 10px auto;
}

.wrapper{
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    padding: .8em;
    background-color: #e3e3e3;
    border-top: 0.125rem dashed #b5b5b5;
    border-bottom: 0.125rem dashed #b5b5b5;
}



#page-title{display:none}

[[=]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-5935/warning.png]]
[[/=]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:anomaly-class-bar-source
|item-number= 8992
|clearance= 2
|container-class= esoteric
|secondary-class= radix
|secondary-icon= http://smlt.wikidot.com/local--files/shineshadowd:gyd4/Yesod.svg
|disruption-class= ekhi
|risk-class= warning
]]


------

[[include component:image-block
        name= https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-8992/Ezra.jpg|
        caption= Junior Researcher Ezra Johannsen.|
        width=300px
    ]]

**Special Containment Procedures:** As SCP-8992 is a member of staff, it has been assigned the object class "Radix"[[footnote]] "Item has been integrated into the Foundation's command structure" -- this may not be the typical use of the class, but he’s one of ours. We need to protect our people.[[/footnote]]. The anomaly is currently at risk of unauthorized neutralization by Foundation staff members compromised by SCP-8992's anomalous properties. Unaffected staff located at Site-216 are tasked with the preservation of the anomaly, which is currently in hiding; staff are currently unauthorized to respond to anomalously compromised individuals with lethal force, but this is under constant review. All orders received from former Site Co-Director Cummings are to be disregarded.

Until the current situation is resolved, Site-216 is operating at drastically reduced capabilities. All research and tasks unrelated to SCP-8992, other than essential containment of other anomalies, have been suspended. Long term containment plans are currently undetermined.

**Description:** SCP-8992 is Foundation Junior Researcher Ezra Johannsen, aged 27. SCP-8992’s idiopathic anomalous properties manifested on 23 June. Its anomalous property is that individuals will regard Junior Researcher Johannsen as a corpse. Any evidence to the contrary is either undetectable or will be dismissed by compromised individuals: 
* They appear unable to perceive any attempts at communication by SCP-8992, including speech and written text;
* Locomotion by SCP-8992 is either not perceived, or perceived as resulting from assistance granted by non-affected individuals;
* Evidence of SCP-8992’s liveness will be dismissed, often in an irate and aggressive manner; 
* Affected individuals have been shown to misremember relevant events, including the actions of non-affected individuals regarding SCP-8992.

All medical tests run on SCP-8992 support the argument that the anomaly is not a corpse.[[footnote]] As if the fact he’s walking and talking isn’t enough.[[/footnote]] Testing has been halted due to the endangerment of SCP-8992’s safety and health. See below timeline for further details.

Not all individuals are susceptible to SCP-8992’s effects. It is estimated 52% of Site-216’s staff are affected and perceive Junior Researcher Johannsen as a corpse. This estimate cannot be trusted – it is currently believed certain individuals onsite perceive the anomaly as a corpse, but claim otherwise in an attempt to aid in the “corpse”’s destruction.[[footnote]] We’re on to you. [[/footnote]]

**Timeline of Events:** 

[[table  style="border-collapse:collapse; width: 100%;"]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="font-weight:bold; padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; color: white; background-color: #64030f; width: 12%;"]]
Date
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="font-weight:bold; padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; color: white; background-color: #64030f; width: 88%;"]]
Event Description
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/23
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Anomaly manifests, causing an incident in Site cafeteria; Johannsen retreats to the room of an unaffected colleague for the day due to emotional distress and signs off work for the same reason.[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/24
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Johannsen attempts to go swimming in the Site's recreation suite. An intense verbal argument occurs between unaffected and compromised staff, who complain of Johannsen's presence due to hygiene concerns. Johannsen retreats from the area.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/25
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Johannsen returns to work, only to find his tasks have been reassigned. He is supported through this by an unaffected team member. Returning to his dormitory room, he enters into a physical confrontation with members of the janitorial team who are emptying the room of his possessions.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/26
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Site-216 Co-Directors Eleanor Cameron and Nigel Cummings meet to discuss the anomaly. It becomes evident Cummings is affected by the anomaly and incorrectly perceives Johannsen as a corpse. 
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/27
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Testing is arranged by Cameron to demonstrate to Cummings and other affected staff that Johannsen is alive. Video transcript of the encounter follows: 
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: 0em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; background-color: #F5F5F5; width: 100%;" colspan="2";]]
Site-216, Medical Bay. Director Cummings enters. Johannsen lies on a medical gurney, he appears anxious. Electrode pads linked to an EKG machine are attached to his chest. Director Cameron stands next to him.

Cameron presents Cummings with the results of medical tests -- including blood analysis, brain scans, and responsive tests -- which conclusively prove Johannsen's liveness.

These are all dismissed by Cummings. An argument ensues between the two staff. Johannsen remains on the gurney, unable to move and join the conversation due to the EKG pads.

Cameron directs Cummings to the EKG screen displaying Johannsen's heartrate. The argument escalates. Cummings arms himself with a scalpel and paces towards Johannsen. The latter recoils.

Cameron attempts to grab Cummings, but throws him off balance. He falls forward, and the scalpel severs Johannsen's right thumb.

Johannsen screams. He disconnects himself from the EKG machine, and flees the room. Cameron follows. Immediately following this incident, both Cameron and Cummings issue sitewide communications disavowing one another and claiming sole leadership of the Site.[[footnote]] Given the obvious anomalous compromising of Cummings, Site leadership would have fallen to Cameron regardless. [[/footnote]] 
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/28
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Cummings orders affected members of staff to search for Johannsen room by room. Physical violence follows as divisions deepen between normal staff and those affected by the anomaly.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/29
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
The Site is placed under red-level quarantine by Overwatch Command.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
06/30
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Cummings issues a directive to all compromised staff to destroy Johannsen. Director Cameron initiates a lockdown of the Site armory due to the unpredictable and hostile actions of disgraced former Director Cummings.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: center; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 12%;"]]
07/01[[/cell]]
[[cell style="padding: .75em .5em; text-align: left; border: 2px solid #d4d4d4; width: 88%;"]]
Unaffected staff begin erecting barricades across the Site to aid in the defense of Johannsen. 
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]
@@@@
@@@@
= **Further updates to follow. Situation currently ongoing.**
@@@@
@@@@
------

= [[size 150%]] **Addendum 001: SCP-8992 Interview Log** [[/size]]

[[div class="interview"]]
**Foreword:** The following interview was arranged by Site Co-Director Eleanor Cameron to document Johannsen’s own recollection of events, and the psychological impact of SCP-8992 upon him.

------
//[Junior Researcher Johannsen is sat at the interview room table, opposite Director Cameron. His right hand is bandaged.]//

**Cameron:** Given what’s just happened… are you sure you want to do this today, Ezra?

**Johannsen:** I- I’m sure. My name is Junior Researcher Ezra Johannsen. I’ve been employed by the Foundation, at Site-216, for six years. On June 23, I, myself, became an anomaly. I felt no change. I was in the site cafeteria, sat at a table... and suddenly people started screaming.

**Cameron:** What for?

**Johannsen:** For medical aid. Medical aid, for me. Half the people I was sat with – friends, colleagues I’ve known since I joined – thought… they thought I was dead. 

//[Johannsen, agitated, hits the table with his fist.]//

**Johannsen:** The other half, people like you, Director Cameron, could see that I, quite clearly, was not. Someone came over, pushed me to the floor, tried to do compressions on my chest. It hurt. It hurt a lot. Someone else pulled them off me and it just, it just escalated. People wouldn’t listen, they wouldn’t listen to me, nor you, nor anyone. You grabbed me by the arm, and pulled me out of there, along with some others who were – hopefully still are – unaffected.

**Cameron:** It's just... escalated from there.

//[Johannsen begins to pull back the bandages from his hand. He fights back tears.]//

**Johannsen:** Look what they did to me. I'm maimed. I liked Director Cummings, I sat next to him at the Christmas party. But he... he hurt me. He hurt me so much.

**Cameron:** And, I think we should talk about today. I think you should record what happened.

**Johannsen:** I’ve been hiding since then. Or more accurately, you’ve all been hiding me. But today, I was on my way back from the commissary with two people I trusted. I know I shouldn’t have gone, but I was craving something sweet, I needed some kind of pick-me-up. But the other group saw me. Someone shouted: “I’ve found it!” It. //It// stung. The next thing I know I’m running, but I’m too slow – they’re on me, and I was screaming, but they were dragging me. And I kept screaming and screaming but there were too many of them. And then I realized where they were taking me. To the crematorium. They wanted to burn me, Ellie. They wanted to burn me alive.

**Cameron:** Ezra…

//[Cameron stands, and walks around to Johannsen. She bends down and hugs him.]//

**Johannsen:** But you, and the others, found me. Thank god you found me, just in time. But I don’t know how much more of this I can take. 

//[Johannsen begins to cry. His tears dampen Cameron’s shoulder.]//

**Cameron:** It’s okay. That’s enough for today, I think. Let’s get you out of here.

//[Still embraced, Cameron helps Johannsen from his chair, and accompanies him from the room.]//

[[/div]]
